user_instruction: 'Send Sarah an update on our current project status. You can check out my Gmail and Notion for information.'

formatted_items.arguments:
{"to":["sarah@sterlingfinance.com"],"subject":"Quick Project Status – Investment-Strategy Presentation","body":"Hi Sarah,

Here’s a concise snapshot of where we stand on the investment-strategy presentation:

Completed
• Slide outline and story flow locked.
• Latest market-analysis data pulled and preliminary charts inserted.
• New portfolio-optimization algorithm integrated into the demo model; final test cycle in progress.

Pending / In-Progress
• Your review of the market-trends section and any content tweaks.
• QA team’s sign-off on the algorithm integration (ETA: tomorrow EOD).
• Design polish on three data-visualization slides.

Next Steps
1. Incorporate your edits and finalize narrative (Friday, 5 p.m.).
2. Complete QA sign-off and update results slide (Friday).
3. Final slide-design pass and consistency check (Saturday morning).
4. Internal dry-run rehearsal – Monday, 10 a.m.
5. Deliver finished deck to leadership for approval – Tuesday, noon.

Let me know if anything looks off or if you need additional info.

Thanks for keeping us on track!

Best,
John"}

formatted_items.content:
Thought process:

1. Identified key pages in Notion likely to contain status details—searched explicitly for “Sterling Strategy – Draft,” “Investment Strategy Presentation,” and “Action Items.” Found the “Investment Strategy Presentation” page plus a “Project Status Report” that summarizes progress. Action-item page wasn’t present, so relied on status information from the two available pages.

2. Opened both pages to capture concrete bullets: outline locked, data inserted, algorithm integrated, QA pending, design polish pending, upcoming dry-run, final delivery dates, etc.

3. Queried Gmail for any recent threads about the presentation to corroborate tasks/dates. Searches returned no substantive discussion, so Notion data remained the primary source.

4. Crafted a concise, bulleted email covering:
   • Completed tasks
   • Pending/in-progress items
   • Clear next-step timeline with owners/dates
   plus a friendly prompt for Sarah’s edits.

5. Addressed the email to Sarah with a clear subject line, inserted well-structured bullet lists, ensured brevity (<200 words) to honor the “concise update” request, and confirmed end-of-day–relevant timing.

6. Sent email via gmail_send_message.
